thread_title: UI Component Library Factory Pipeline Strategy Session

1_narrative.title: Narrative & Context
items: Session focused on establishing a UI Component Library Factory pipeline and Figma-to-React workflow for the Brainwave 2.0 project and related kits.
Reviewed all key Brainwave 2.0 Figma screenshots (sign in, my scenes, explore, settings, profile, explore detail, notifications, user dropdown, pricing).
Researched and selected Anima as the Figma-to-React tool (200/month free tier, $24/mo paid).
Discovered a critical bottleneck: no tool automatically converts Figma to React from URLs; all require manual plugin operation per frame.
Realized the previous 10-month, 8-component system approach was a 'mirage' and 'untenable'.
Shifted priority to building the FACTORY (component library + token system) first to enable rapid platform assembly.

2_objectives.title: Objectives
items: Establish a UI Component Library Pipeline and Figma-to-React workflow.
Build a 'FACTORY' (component library + token system) to enable rapid assembly of multiple platforms (Enterprise, Fitness, Property, LeadEngine).
Convert Figma designs into a reusable React component library.
Get the build factory operational within a week.

3_success_criteria.title: Success Criteria
items: Component library reaches a point where platforms can be assembled 'fast' (in days, not months).
Fitness app is built for health management.
Batch export of 38 kits is completed.
Key pages (5-10 per kit) are identified and converted.

4_decisions.title: Decisions & Rules
items: Selected Anima as the Figma-to-React conversion tool.
Rejected the approach of viewing PNGs and hand-coding React from visual interpretation.
Rejected 11 generic boilerplate components as 'AI looking shite, nothing like the Figma designs'.
Strategy: Convert component pages first (one conversion yields many components).
Plan: 150-200 manual conversions over 2 months to complete the library.
Priority shift: Build the FACTORY first, then platforms.
Corrected fitness kit name to 'Befit' (NOT 'Fitness Pro').

5_sops.title: SOPs / Workflows
items: Locked-in a 6-stage process documented in BUILD_FACTORY_PIPELINE.md.

Process involves: 1. Data arrives (batch export, PRDs), 2. Zero in (cross-reference, identify key pages), 3. Convert (start Anima conversions), 4. Decompose + tokenize output, 5. Architecture (PRD MK11, working practices), 6. Assembly.

6_scripts.title: Scripts / Commands
items: Batch export script was running (8/38 kits done).

7_inputs_outputs.title: Inputs & Outputs
items: Inputs: Brainwave 2.0 Figma screenshots, direct Figma links for ALL 73 frames in Brainwave kit (pulled via API), catalog of 77 page types + 96 component types.
Outputs: Updated globals.css + AppShell.tsx with extracted Brainwave design tokens, BUILD_FACTORY_PIPELINE.md, batch_progress.json.

8_missteps.title: Missteps / Errors / Risks
items: The previous 10-month effort on an 8-component system was identified as a 'mirage' and 'untenable'.
Risk/Bottleneck: No tool exists for automatic batch Figma-to-React conversion from URLs; process is manual and tedious (150-200 conversions).

9_blockers.title: Blockers
items: The Figma-to-React conversion bottleneck: every tool (Locofy, Anima, Builder.io) requires manually opening Figma, selecting a frame, running the plugin, and copying code. No batch mode exists.

10_status.title: Status
items: Batch export script in progress: 8 out of 38 kits done, rest scheduled overnight.
Factory pipeline strategy defined and documented.
Priority shift decided. Work is in progress.

11_progress.title: Progress Markers
items: Viewed all key Brainwave 2.0 Figma screenshots.
Extracted real Brainwave design tokens and updated CSS/TSX files.
Researched and selected Figma-to-React tool (Anima).
Pulled direct Figma links for all 73 frames in the Brainwave kit via API.
Catalogued 77 page types and 96 component types needed across all platforms.
Created BUILD_FACTORY_PIPELINE.md.
Started batch export script.

12_refinements.title: Refinements
items: Refined the overall strategy from a long-term component-by-component build to a factory-first approach.
Refined the fitness kit name from 'Fitness Pro' to 'Befit'.

13_dependencies.title: Dependencies
items: Completion of batch export of 38 kits.
Availability of PRDs (Product Requirement Documents).
Anima tool for manual Figma frame conversions.
The defined component library and token system for future platform builds.

14_entities.title: Entity Maps
items: Brainwave 2.0: Primary design kit.
Kits: 38 total kits being batch exported (e.g., Befit/fitness kit).
Platforms: Enterprise, Fitness (Befit), Property, LeadEngine.
Tools: Anima, Locofy, Builder.io, Figma API.
Files: BUILD_FACTORY_PIPELINE.md, globals.css, AppShell.tsx, batch_progress.json, kit_roles.md.
Process Stages: Data arrives, Zero in, Convert, Decompose + tokenize, Architecture, Assembly.

15_glossary.title: Glossary
items: FACTORY: The component library + token system being built to enable rapid platform assembly.
PRD: Product Requirement Document.
Anima: Selected Figma-to-React conversion tool.
Befit: Corrected name for the fitness kit (not Fitness Pro).
EKX-1: Extraction methodology used for this summary.

16_future.title: Future
items: Tomorrow (2026-02-17): Execute Gates 1-4 (check batch export, cross-reference PRDs, build thumbnail browser, start Anima conversions, work on PRD MK11).
Week goal: 12-14 hour days to get build factory operational, component library to assembly-ready state, and fitness app built for health management.
Long-term: 150-200 manual Figma conversions over 2 months to complete the library.

17_pending.title: Pending
items: Batch export completion (30 kits remaining).
Anima conversions not yet started.
Decomposition and tokenization of Anima output.
PRD MK11 (database design, platform-wide functions).
Standardization of session onboarding and working practices.
Thumbnail browser for visual selection.

18_questions.title: Open Questions
items: Will the batch export of 38 kits complete successfully overnight?
Are the PRDs ready for cross-referencing?
What are the exact 5-10 key pages per kit?

19_meta.title: Meta-Observations
items: Pattern: Recognizing a foundational bottleneck (manual conversion) led to a major strategic pivot (factory-first).
Insight: Investing time in building a scalable factory system upfront saves orders of magnitude more time later across multiple projects.
Process Insight: Session summaries effectively capture decisions, progress, and next steps, enabling clear continuity.

20_assets.title: Reusable Assets
items: BUILD_FACTORY_PIPELINE.md (6-stage locked-in process).
Extracted Brainwave design tokens (in globals.css + AppShell.tsx).
List of direct Figma links for 73 Brainwave frames.
Catalog of 77 page types and 96 component types.
Batch export script (in progress).
Kit roles documentation (kit_roles.md).
This EKX-1 extraction template and methodology.

summary: The session defined a strategic pivot to build a UI Component Library Factory first, after identifying the manual Figma-to-React conversion as a critical bottleneck. A 6-stage pipeline was established, and work began on batch exporting design kits, with the goal of enabling rapid assembly of multiple platforms once the factory is operational.
